profiles:
Summary A tech enthusiast passionate about solving real problems using creativity and technology. 9 years of product, engineering & research experience in building internet products. 
 
Successfully turned new ideas into products: conceptualized, launched and grew products. 
 
Launched a few hobby projects/hacks, got adoption from hundred thousands of users and featured in TechCrunch, Mashable, ReadWriteWeb, etc. 
 
Filed 6 patents (2 approved & 4 pending); 3 publications 
 
Specialties: Shipping technically complex products, user centric & data driven agile product development, customer empathy, wire-framing, rapid prototyping/hacking, creating MVPs, product growth. Business Case preparation and analysis Experience Senior Product Manager - Video Yahoo! September 2011  – Present (4 years) Sunnyvale, CA » Successfully on-boarded more than 150 video content providers during 2014 ensuring the correct content rights/restrictions were applied, videos were available on schedule and special use cases were properly supported by coordinating requirements across Business Development, Legal, Video Operations and prioritizing the on-boarding pipeline for the engineers in the Content Ingestion and Enrichment team. Included on-boarding of strategic partners such as as Vevo, NFL, The Weinstein Company, NHL, Saturday Night Live and CNBC. 
 
» Launched self-service portal in beta version currently in use by 40 publishers to manage and view the performance of video content they distribute in the Yahoo network by leading a team of engineers and UX/UI designers that took product from concept to launch of minimum viable product in 10 weeks. 
 
» Rebuilt Yahoo video platform from end-to-end (content ingestion, publishing tools, player, analytics&reporting, ad bookings and front-end experiences) by leading cross-functional team distributed across multiple regions resulting in: 
- New low-latency analytics portal with increased reporting metrics, accuracy and scalability while reducing report availability from 72+ hours to near real-time 
- Simplified video programming work-flows increasing the number of editors able to program video from 5 specialized video editors to Yahoo’s entire global editorial team 
- Implementation of player QoS monitoring that allowed us to evaluate player latency and reduce it to best in-class industry standards 
- Creation of modular video framework that allowed product managers and editors to create front-end video experiences/pages within minutes and without requiring intervention from engineering teams 
- Migration of video experiences in more than 200 sites globally 
 Mobile Alliances Program Mgr - Connected Life -Latin Am. Yahoo! July 2008  –  September 2011  (3 years 3 months) Sunnyvale, CA Responsible for coordinating all mobile product releases for Latin America region, including strategic partners America Movil, Telefonica and TIM Brasil.	 
 
» Improved communication of new product releases and performance against audience and revenue goals by developing a Monthly Operational Dashboard and leading a monthly cross-functional meeting with Marketing, Legal, Editorial, Sales and the Latin America Regional GM. 
 
» Reduced implementation timeline of co-branded mobile search agreements by 50% (from 8 weeks to 4 weeks) by creating project kick-off documentation including forms to capture partner requirements, working with engineering to make configurable those elements that were common across all partners and defining quality assurance process for partner acceptance. Deployed 18 partners in 12 months vs 4 partners in 6 months prior to process redesign.  
 
» Prepared yearly audience and revenue forecasts by performing market competitive and strategic analyses that were to define team’s annual goals. 
 
» Led the development of the 2010 World Cup Mobile site launched in 13 languages and 40 markets, which resulted in a 500% increased in page views and unique users to the Yahoo Sports mobile. Senior Product Manager Motricity June 2006  –  July 2008  (2 years 2 months) Raleigh-Durham, North Carolina Area Responsible for the definition and execution of the roadmap of Motricity’s Fuel Portal, a white-label portal deployed by mobile operators such as Alltel, Bell Canada, Leap Wireless. Managed team of 4 developers.  
 
» Improved product roadmap alignment process with partners by designing and implementing a “feature prioritization” framework as a tool to assist in the evaluation of features to be included in customer releases. 
» Created “Portal Monthly Analysis by Customer” report to monitor product performance and profitability, which the company adopted as a template to report results of all our products to Executive Management. 
» Achieved content cost reductions of 25% ($350K) in 2007 by driving the instrumentation of features for more accurate reporting that allowed the renegotiation of contracts with content providers. 
» Supported Sales Team by providing product presentations, documentation and business cases Product Director Emida July 2004  –  June 2006  (2 years) Miami/Fort Lauderdale Area • Assisted Executive Management in the preparation of presentations and documentation for potential investors which resulted in a merger transaction.  
• Participated as part of cross-functional team that reviewed and defined Product Development Lifecycle methodology for merged entity.  
• Defined functional requirements and navigation flow for PUNTOflex self-service kiosk  
• Preparation of business cases and presentations for potential clients and partners. Director, Product Engineering CycleLogic Mobile Solutions January 2001  –  July 2004  (3 years 7 months) Miami/Fort Lauderdale Area Managed team responsible for the definition, development and go-to-market strategy of new products resulting in several “first–to- market” products in the Latin American region, including: mobile operator WAP based portals, ring-tones, SMS Banking alerts and SMS voting for TV shows. 
 
» Developed Latin America’s first Multi-access Portal (SMS, Web, Mobile and Voice) for BellSouth International by overseeing team of product managers and coordinating with Engineering team the development and integration of the different elements of the portal. Drove product from concept to reality in 9 months. 
» Served as liasion for BellSouth International’s Latin American mobile operators on product, technical and implementation related issues during the deployment of the Multi-access portal in their 10 mobile operators in Latin America and their subsequent operation. 
» Led the development of CycleLogic’s US Market entry strategy, and conducted initial sales efforts with Verizon and AT&T. 
» Supported the Business Development team in establishing overall business models for the products, identifying, evaluating and negotiating with potential partners. Senior Technical Project Manager CycleLogic Mobile Solutions November 1999  –  January 2001  (1 year 3 months) Miami/Fort Lauderdale Area Hired to build and lead team responsible for pre-sales, implementation and post-sales of CycleLogic’s platforms and solutions. 
 
» Successfully deployed CycleLogic’s Wireless Internet Server (WIS) in 28 leading mobile operators across 13 countries by defining Project Management Methodology and managing a team of 8 Technical Project Managers based out of Mexico, Brazil, Venezuela, Colombia, Chile and Argentina.  
» Oversaw integration of WIS with mobile operator’s provisioning and billing systems, including pre-paid platforms. 
» Served as liaison between the Sales & Marketing Team and the Development Team to ensure customer and market expectations were aligned with product capabilities. Financial Analyst Visa International May 1999  –  November 1999  (7 months) • Provided support in the elaboration of the Annual Budget for the Latin American Region. 
• Developed spreadsheet models to automate monthly reports presented to Executive Management. 
• Generated statistical forecast by country and products to validate the budget’s growth objectives. Consultant Andersen Consulting (now Accenture) July 1994  –  July 1997  (3 years 1 month) Worked in engagements for clients in Venezuela, Honduras and Dominican Republic.  
Promoted to Consultant after 2 years. Evaluated in Top 5% among peer group in each of 3 years. 
 
Engagements included: 
Merger Integration Strategy of Banks resulting in the 2nd largest bank in the Dominican Republic: 
• Analyzed existing synergies between merging organizations and recommended business strategies for the resulting bank. 
• Developed financial models to simulate multiple scenarios in order to evaluate the effect of our recommendations on the client’s financial statements. 
 
Strategic Plan Definition for Venezuela’s 2nd largest bank at the time: 
• Prepared materials for Strategic Planning Workshop  
• Analyzed the competitive environment and industry trends to assess client’s target market and financial position. 
• Deliverables included: Business Strategy, Human Resources Strategy and IT Strategy. 
 
Loans System Migration and Installation: 
• Managed professional, support and client staff in the implementation and migration of a Loans system. 
• Facilitated negotiations between client and vendor to establish consensus on software roll-out process. 
• Conducted the functional testing to assure the system met the specified requirements Senior Product Manager - Video Yahoo! Experience Senior Product Manager, Virtual Reality Dolby Laboratories August 2015  – Present (1 month) San Francisco, California A complete immersion in a virtual world (behind those Head Mounted Displays) requires 'tricking'​ one's brain into believing what they are sensing. Sight can be as limiting as the field of view. Sound adds to what sight can't grasp - a bull charging from behind, a rattlesnake on the right or even a whisper moving from the left ear behind the head to the right ear.  
 
With Dolby Atmos for Virtual Reality technology and tools, we aim to help content creators create object-based sound on a 3 dimensional space and encode their creation such that they are decoded and rendered binaurally (headphones) with precision and efficiency when an end user listens to the content. The artistic intent and creative integrity is maintained and preserve from the content creation to consumption by an end user thereby ensuring a full immersion into the virtual world.

Published three articles in Hindustan Times newspaper (Bombay Edition), 2007 Senior Product Manager, Virtual Reality Dolby Laboratories August 2015  – Present (1 month) San Francisco, California A complete immersion in a virtual world (behind those Head Mounted Displays) requires 'tricking'​ one's brain into believing what they are sensing. Sight can be as limiting as the field of view. Sound adds to what sight can't grasp - a bull charging from behind, a rattlesnake on the right or even a whisper moving from the left ear behind the head to the right ear.  
 
With Dolby Atmos for Virtual Reality technology and tools, we aim to help content creators create object-based sound on a 3 dimensional space and encode their creation such that they are decoded and rendered binaurally (headphones) with precision and efficiency when an end user listens to the content. The artistic intent and creative integrity is maintained and preserve from the content creation to consumption by an end user thereby ensuring a full immersion into the virtual world.

Summary Lee Parry is a product manager and designer specializing in mobile internet consumer products. 
 
From a background in performing arts Lee spent 6 years working for Real World Multimedia, a small team of designers and developers, creating Enhanced CD interfaces, DVDs, motion video and developing the web presence for the Real World family of companies and charities. Working on projects as diverse as infrastructure, database design, e-commerce, front end design and development for web, applications and dvd video. 
 
Lee has worked with a variety of clients in a freelance and consulting capacity, across desktop and mobile, in addition to co-developing Chatsum, a social browsing extension and website. Lee joined Yahoo! in Stockholm, Sweden in 2006. 
 
Lee currently works for Yahoo! leading the product management team for mobile and tablets in the Communications and Communities group, and is based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Specialties:Product management, strategy & design.
